intro: Campanula akhdarensis, commonly known as the Armenian bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Caucasus region. It features showy, bell-shaped blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight. Campanula akhdarensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
